Headline: A busier Haro Strait
Chatter: Busier means Noisier: More container ships, tankers, cruise ships and ferries means more noise confronting endangered southern resident orcas in their core summer foraging habitat in the Haro Strait.

Headline: Noisy waters
Chatter: The endangered southern resident orca whales that visit Puget Sound confront the most noisy waters in their core summer foraging habitat on the west side of San Juan Island, Fraser River Delta and the eastern end of the Strait of Juan de Fuca. Noise is caused by vessel traffic, especially commercial shipping.

Source and brief description: Animation of a single dive, with bathymetry
